autotransform.validator package

Submodules

autotransform.validator.base module

The base class and associated classes for Validator components.

exception autotransform.validator.base.ValidationError(issue: autotransform.validator.base.ValidationResult)

Bases: Exception

An error raised by validation failing on a run.

_issue

The validation result that triggered the error.

Type

ValidationResult

_message

A message representing why the validation failed.

Type

str

class autotransform.validator.base.ValidationResult

Bases: TypedDict

Represents the result of an attempt at validation.

level: autotransform.validator.base.ValidationResultLevel
message: Optional[str]
validator: autotransform.validator.type.ValidatorType
class autotransform.validator.base.ValidationResultLevel(value)

Bases: int, enum.Enum

The result level of a validation indicating how bad a validation failure is.

ERROR = 2
NONE = 0
WARNING = 1

class autotransform.validator.base.Validator(params: autotransform.validator.base.TParams)

Bases: Generic[autotransform.validator.base.TParams], abc.ABC

The base for Validator components. Validators test that the codebase is still healthy after a transformation.

_params

The paramaters that control operation of the Validator. Should be defined using a TypedDict in subclasses.

Type

TParams

bundle() → autotransform.validator.base.ValidatorBundle

Generates a JSON encodable bundle. If a component’s params are not JSON encodable this method should be overridden to provide an encodable version.

Returns

The encodable bundle.

Return type

ValidatorBundle

abstract static from_data(data: Mapping[str, Any]) → autotransform.validator.base.Validator

Produces an instance of the component from decoded params. Implementations should assert that the data provided matches expected types and is valid.

Parameters

data (Mapping[str, Any]) – The JSON decoded params from an encoded bundle.

Returns

An instance of the Validator.

Return type

Validator

get_params() → autotransform.validator.base.TParams

Gets the paramaters used to set up the Validator.

Returns

The paramaters used to set up the Validator.

Return type

TParams

abstract static get_type() → autotransform.validator.type.ValidatorType

Used to map Validator components 1:1 with an enum, allowing construction from JSON.

Returns

The unique type associated with this Validator.

Return type

ValidatorType

params: autotransform.validator.base.TParams
abstract validate(batch: autotransform.batcher.base.Batch) → autotransform.validator.base.ValidationResult

Validate that a Batch that has undergone transformation does not produce any issues such as test failures or type errors.

Parameters

batch (Batch) – The transformed Batch to validate.

Returns

The result of the validation check indicating the severity of any

validation failures as well as an associated message

Return type

ValidationResult

class autotransform.validator.base.ValidatorBundle

Bases: TypedDict

A bundled version of the Validator object used for JSON encoding.

params: Mapping[str, Any]
type: autotransform.validator.type.ValidatorType

autotransform.validator.factory module

A simple factory for producing Validators from type and param information.

class autotransform.validator.factory.ValidatorFactory

Bases: object

The factory class for Validators. Maps a type to a Validator.

_map

A mapping from ValidatorType to the from_data function of the appropriate Validator.

Type

Dict[ValidatorType, Callable[[Mapping[str, Any]], Validator]]

static get(bundle: autotransform.validator.base.ValidatorBundle) → autotransform.validator.base.Validator

Simple get method using the _map attribute.

Parameters

bundle (ValidatorBundle) – The bundled Validator type and params.

Returns

An instance of the associated Validator.

Return type

Validator

autotransform.validator.type module

The type of Validator, used create a 1:1 mapping.

class autotransform.validator.type.ValidatorType(value)

Bases: str, enum.Enum

A simple enum for 1:1 Validator to type mapping.

Module contents

Validators take in a Batch that has undergone transformation and validate that the changes do not produce any issues/errors. They may run test cases or check linting or type checking.
